nistRequirement: a. Establish usage restrictions, configuration requirements, and connection requirements for each type of wireless access to the system. b. Authorize each type of wireless access to the system prior to establishing such connections. c. Disable, when not intended for use, wireless networking capabilities prior to issuance and deployment. d. Protect wireless access to the system using authentication and encryption.

settings.description: Enforces WPA2-Enterprise security protocol for all organizational Wi-Fi networks, requiring 802.1X authentication with RADIUS server. This prevents use of insecure WPA-PSK or open networks.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Sign in to Microsoft Intune admin center
2. Navigate to Devices > Configuration profiles > Create profile
3. Select platform (Windows/iOS/Android) and profile type 'Wi-Fi'
4. Configure:
   - Wi-Fi type: Enterprise
   - Security type: WPA2-Enterprise
   - EAP type: EAP-TLS (recommended) or PEAP-MSCHAPv2
5. Configure certificate profiles for authentication
6. Assign to device groups
7. Verify deployment status in Intune reporting

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Directly enforces requirement (d) to protect wireless access using authentication and encryption. WPA2-Enterprise provides strong encryption (AES) and enterprise-grade authentication via 802.1X, preventing unauthorized wireless access.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: 03.01.16.d - Protect wireless access to the system using authentication and encryption

settings.displayName: Require EAP-TLS Authentication for Enterprise Wi-Fi
settings.description: Requires EAP-TLS (Extensible Authentication Protocol - Transport Layer Security) as the authentication method for enterprise Wi-Fi. EAP-TLS is the most secure EAP method, using certificate-based mutual authentication and eliminating password vulnerabilities.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Ensure PKI infrastructure is configured for certificate distribution
2. In Intune admin center, navigate to Devices > Configuration profiles
3. Create or edit Enterprise Wi-Fi profile
4. Under Authentication method, select 'EAP-TLS'
5. Configure:
   - Root certificate for server validation
   - Client certificate (SCEP or PKCS)
   - Identity privacy (outer identity) if needed
6. Deploy certificate profiles before Wi-Fi profile
7. Test authentication with enrolled devices
8. Monitor connection success in Intune reports

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Implements strong authentication requirement (d) by mandating certificate-based authentication. EAP-TLS provides mutual authentication between client and server, protecting against credential theft and man-in-the-middle attacks.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: 03.01.16.d - Protect wireless access to the system using authentication and encryption

settings.description: Forces Wi-Fi profiles to comply with Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) 140-2 for cryptographic modules. This ensures wireless encryption uses validated cryptographic algorithms approved for federal use, providing highest-level encryption assurance.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. In Intune admin center, open Windows Wi-Fi configuration profile
2. Navigate to Wi-Fi settings configuration
3. Locate 'Force Wi-Fi profile to be compliant with FIPS' setting
4. Set to 'Yes' (Enabled)
5. Ensure certificate profiles also use FIPS-compliant algorithms
6. Deploy to Windows devices
7. Test connectivity and verify FIPS mode is active
8. Note: FIPS compliance may not be available on all hardware

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Strengthens encryption requirement (d) by mandating use of FIPS 140-2 validated cryptographic modules. This is critical for organizations processing CUI and ensures wireless encryption meets federal security standards.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: 03.01.16.d - Protect wireless access to the system using authentication and encryption

settings.displayName: Require Compliant Device for Wi-Fi Network Access
settings.description: Requires devices to be marked as compliant by Intune before accessing resources from organizational networks. This enforces that wireless-connected devices meet all security requirements including encryption, OS version, and configuration standards.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Sign in to Microsoft Entra admin center as Conditional Access Administrator
2. Navigate to Protection > Conditional Access > Policies
3. Create new policy or edit existing policy
4. Under Assignments:
   - Users: Select All users (exclude break-glass accounts)
   - Target resources: All cloud apps
   - Conditions: Configure network locations if needed
5. Under Access controls > Grant:
   - Select 'Grant access'
   - Check 'Require device to be marked as compliant'
6. Enable policy
7. Test with compliant and non-compliant devices
8. Monitor sign-in logs for policy enforcement

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Enforces requirements (a) and (b) by establishing usage restrictions and authorization requirements for wireless access. Only devices meeting organizational configuration standards and security policies can access the system after wireless connection.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: 03.01.16.a,b - Establish usage restrictions and authorize wireless access

settings.description: Marks jailbroken (iOS) or rooted (Android) devices as non-compliant, preventing them from connecting to the organizational network. Jailbroken/rooted devices bypass built-in security controls and cannot be trusted for wireless access to systems with CUI.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. In Intune admin center, navigate to Devices > Compliance policies
2. Create or edit iOS/iPadOS or Android compliance policy
3. Under Device Health section:
   - iOS: Set 'Jailbroken devices' to 'Block'
   - Android: Set 'Rooted devices' to 'Block'
4. Configure additional compliance requirements as needed
5. Under Actions for noncompliance:
   - Immediately mark device as noncompliant
   - Send push notification to user
   - Block access after grace period (optional)
6. Assign policy to user groups
7. Test with test device to verify detection
8. Monitor compliance status in Intune reports

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Supports requirement (a) for establishing usage restrictions by preventing compromised devices from wireless network access. Jailbroken/rooted devices have disabled security controls and cannot maintain encryption or authentication integrity.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: 03.01.16.a - Establish usage restrictions for wireless access

settings.displayName: Disable Wi-Fi on Devices Before Deployment
settings.description: Disables Wi-Fi networking capabilities on devices during initial provisioning until authorized Wi-Fi profiles are deployed. This prevents devices from connecting to unauthorized or untrusted wireless networks before organizational controls are in place.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Create device configuration profile for device restrictions
2. In Intune admin center, go to Devices > Configuration profiles
3. Create profile:
   - Platform: Windows 10 and later / iOS/iPadOS / Android Enterprise
   - Profile type: Device restrictions
4. Under Wireless settings:
   - Windows: Enable 'Block WiFi'
   - iOS: Enable 'Block modifying Wi-Fi settings'
   - Android: Configure via device restrictions
5. Assign to 'All Devices' or staging device group
6. After provisioning complete, deploy authorized Wi-Fi profiles
7. Create second policy to allow Wi-Fi once profiles are deployed
8. Use dynamic groups to transition devices between policies

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Directly implements requirement (c) to disable wireless networking capabilities when not intended for use, specifically during device issuance and deployment. Prevents unauthorized wireless connections until proper security controls are configured.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: 03.01.16.c - Disable wireless networking capabilities prior to issuance and deployment
